definition: Holy sacrament/Christian rite (esp. Protestant)/also called 聖事|圣事 by Catholics
surname Li/abbr. for 禮記|礼记[Li3 ji4], Classic of Rites

sentences.english: The sacraments are God's Word visible.
The striking feature of the Zwinglian observance of the sacrament was its simplicity.
sentences.chinese: 慈运理派遵守圣礼最突出的特色是它的简洁。

sentences.english: He taught that is more important than the message He communicates to us in the sacraments.
sentences.chinese: 他教导这比神在圣礼中与我们交通的信息更重要。

sentences.english: The other sacrament is Holy Communion. In some churches it is called the Lord's Supper.
sentences.chinese: 另一个圣礼仪式是守圣餐，有些教会也称之为主餐。

sentences.english: The sacrament of the Eucharist received by a congregation.
sentences.chinese: 圣餐某地区全体教徒接受圣餐的圣礼。

sentences.english: The only divinely ordained sacraments are baptism and the Lord's Supper.
sentences.chinese: 唯有浸礼和主餐是神命定的圣礼。

sentences.english: Ancient Tantra is a spiritual system in which sexual love is a sacrament.
sentences.chinese: 古代坦陀罗是一种精神体系，性爱是圣礼。

sentences.english: Soon, she grew old enough to receive the Sacrament of Confirmation.
sentences.chinese: 很快，她长大到了接受圣礼的年龄。

sentences.english: The kingdom of the Right hand describes the ministry of Word and sacrament.
sentences.chinese: 神的国度讲到执行神的话和圣礼的职事。

sentences.english: Sacrament means mystery, relating to the divine presence.
sentences.chinese: 圣礼意味着神秘，与神的显灵有关。

definition: Holy sacrament/Christian rite (esp. Catholic)/also called 聖禮|圣礼 by Protestants
God (in Catholicism)/abbr. for 天主教[Tian1 zhu3 jiao4], Catholicism
